page.title: 10The Dane in Shaw Valley
page.content: The old Biddulph Valley Railway runs through this valley.It closed in 1968. It is now a bridleway and footpath.It is covered by Sycamore,Silver Birch, Willow and Elder.The damp,shady conditions encourage Nettle,Hogweed, Vetch and Bramble to grow. Dane in Shaw Mill lies empty.It last produced printed towels and fabrics. Brookhouse Lane is an old road from Timbersbrook to Congleton.There is a house called The Limes made of millstone grit with Lime trees in the garden.Brookhouse Farm is a dairy farm built of stone.Hoofridge Farm has been renovated.The outhouses were made of brick.There was a notice saying 'Dogs kept on lead if seen among sheep liable to be shot'.Opposite to Dane in Shaw Mill there was a stream pouring raw sewage into the polluted Dane in Shaw Brook.
